channel.title: Router advice, crashing randomly?
channel.description:
hiya guys n girls,
I've been trying to download a file for some time now but came upon a persitant error with my router, it has repeatidly crashed part way though the download.
I've tried this on 2 network cards, different brands and types and this has not fixed the error, which lead me to assume it is the router.
I order to fix it i must turn off the router and reboot it. The router is completly fine surfing and on msn but downloading anything big caused it to crash. I have the latest firmware on my wireless.
Many thanks
MuNkY.

item.title: Router advice, crashing randomly?
item.dc:creator: @MuNkY MuNkY
item.description:
@MuNkY wrote:

ThugLife:

It might be an error on your isp’s side?

thats what im hopeing it is achurly, i spose ill have to give them a ring. thx for that mate.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2007, 01:22:33 PM[/size][hr]sorry for the double post but i found the solution,

i simply changed the name of my computer from something really long like n-42324zero22 to something e.g Munky and it works 100% perfect now.

If anyone else experienceing my problem i surgest trying this first.

Read full topic
